task.title: Running the demo build
task.shortdesc: After you install the full-easy-install package, run the demo build to see the type of output that is produced by the DITA Open Toolkit.

step.stepresult: You receive the following prompt:[echo] [echo] Please enter the name of the output directory or press return [echo] to accept the default. [input] The output directory (out): [out]

You receive the following prompt:[echo] Please enter the type of output to generate. [echo] Options include: eclipse, tocjs, htmlhelp, javahelp, pdf, or web [echo] Use lowercase letters. [echo] [input] The output type: (eclipse, tocjs, htmlhelp, javahelp, pdf, [web], docbook)

step.cmd: Press Enter to accept the default transformation type: web.
step.info: This will build XHTML files from the DITA source.
step.stepresult: You receive the following prompt:[echo] Ready to build C:\DITA-OT1.6.M5\samples\hierarchy.ditamap [echo] for web in out [echo] [input] Continue? (Y, [y], N, n)

step.cmd: Press Y or y to start the DITA-OT transformation.
step.stepresult: The DITA-OT logs information to the command-prompt or terminal window. At the end, you see the following information:prompt.output: [echo] [echo] output in the out directory [echo] [echo] Before rebuilding, please delete the output or the directory. BUILD SUCCESSFUL Total time: X minutes X seconds

step.cmd: Go to the out/ directory and open the toc.html file in a Web browser.

fig.title: XHTML output for the sample files

image.alt: The garage sample files transformed to XHTML and viewed in a Web browser

taskbody.result: The DITA-OT transformed the hierarchy.ditamap file (located in the samples directory) to XHTML; it wrote the output to the out/ directory.
